members.member:
Interface for listening to escher serialization events.
@author Glen Stampoultzis (glens at apache.org)

member.name: T:NPOI.DDF.EscherProperty
M:NPOI.DDF.EscherProperty.#ctor(System.Int16)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The id is distinct from the actual property number. The id includes the property number the blip id flag and an indicator whether the property is complex or not.

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherProperty.#ctor(System.Int16,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.The three parameters are combined to form a property id.
member.param: The property number.
if set to true [is complex].
if set to true [is blip id].

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherProperty.SerializeSimplePart(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Escher properties consist of a simple fixed Length part and a complex variable Length part. The fixed Length part is Serialized first.
member.param: The data.
The pos.

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherProperty.SerializeComplexPart(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Escher properties consist of a simple fixed Length part and a complex variable Length part. The fixed Length part is Serialized first.
member.param: The data.
The pos.

member.name: P:NPOI.DDF.EscherProperty.Id
member.summary: Gets the id.

member.name: P:NPOI.DDF.EscherProperty.PropertyNumber
member.summary: Gets the property number.

member.name: P:NPOI.DDF.EscherProperty.IsComplex
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is complex.
member.value: true if this instance is complex; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:NPOI.DDF.EscherProperty.IsBlipId
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is blip id.
member.value: true if this instance is blip id; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:NPOI.DDF.EscherProperty.Name
member.summary: Gets the name.

member.name: P:NPOI.DDF.EscherProperty.PropertySize
member.summary: Most properties are just 6 bytes in Length. Override this if we're dealing with complex properties.

member.name: T:NPOI.DDF.EscherBlipWMFRecord
member.summary: The blip record is used to hold details about large binary objects that occur in escher such as JPEG, GIF, PICT and WMF files. The contents of the stream is usually compressed. Inflate can be used to decompress the data. @author Glen Stampoultzis

member.name: T:NPOI.DDF.EscherBlipRecord
member.summary: @author Glen Stampoultzis @version $Id: EscherBlipRecord.java 569827 2007-08-26 15:26:29Z yegor $

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

The f.

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherRecord.FillFields(System.Byte[],System.Int32,NPOI.DDF.EscherRecordFactory)
member.summary: The contract of this method is to deSerialize an escher record including it's children.
member.param: The byte array containing the Serialized escher records.
The offset into the byte array.
A factory for creating new escher records.

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherRecord.ReadHeader(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the 8 byte header information and populates the options and recordId records.
member.param: the byte array to Read from
the offset to start Reading from
member.returns: the number of bytes remaining in this record. This

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherRecord.Serialize
member.summary: Serializes to a new byte array. This is done by delegating to Serialize(int, byte[]);

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherRecord.Serialize(System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Serializes to an existing byte array without serialization listener. This is done by delegating to Serialize(int, byte[], EscherSerializationListener).
member.param: the offset within the data byte array.
the data array to Serialize to.

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherRecord.Serialize(System.Int32,System.Byte[],NPOI.DDF.EscherSerializationListener)
member.summary: Serializes the record to an existing byte array.
member.param: the offset within the byte array.
the offset within the byte array
a listener for begin and end serialization events. This. is useful because the serialization is hierarchical/recursive and sometimes you need to be able break into that.

member.name: T:NPOI.DDF.EscherComplexProperty
member.summary: A complex property differs from a simple property in that the data can not fit inside a 32 bit integer. See the specification for more detailed information regarding exactly what is stored here. @author Glen Stampoultzis

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherComplexProperty.#ctor(System.Int16,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Create a complex property using the property id and a byte array containing the complex data value.
member.param: The id consists of the property number, a flag indicating whether this is a blip id and a flag indicating that this is a complex property.
The value of this property.

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherComplexProperty.#ctor(System.Int16,System.Boolean,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Create a complex property using the property number, a flag to indicate whether this is a blip reference and the complex property data.
member.param: The property number.
Whether this is a blip id. Should be false.
The value of this complex property.

member.name: T:NPOI.DDF.EscherOptRecord
member.summary: The opt record is used to store property values for a shape. It is the key to determining the attributes of a shape. Properties can be of two types: simple or complex. Simple types are fixed Length. Complex properties are variable Length. @author Glen Stampoultzis

The off set.

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.DefaultEscherRecordFactory.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.DefaultEscherRecordFactory.CreateRecord(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates an escher record including the any children contained under that record. An exception is thrown if the record could not be generated.
member.param: The byte array containing the records
The starting offset into the byte array

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.DefaultEscherRecordFactory.RecordsToMap(System.Type[])
member.summary: Converts from a list of classes into a map that Contains the record id as the key and the Constructor in the value part of the map. It does this by using reflection to look up the RECORD_ID field then using reflection again to find a reference to the constructor.
member.param: The records to convert
member.returns: The map containing the id/constructor pairs.

member.name: T:NPOI.DDF.EscherClientAnchorRecord
member.summary: The escher client anchor specifies which rows and cells the shape is bound to as well as the offsets within those cells. Each cell is 1024 units wide by 256 units long regardless of the actual size of the cell. The EscherClientAnchorRecord only applies to the top-most shapes. Shapes contained in groups are bound using the EscherChildAnchorRecords. @author Glen Stampoultzis

member.summary: Gets or sets the flag.
member.value: 0 = Move and size with Cells, 2 = Move but don't size with cells, 3 = Don't move or size with cells.

member.name: P:NPOI.DDF.EscherClientAnchorRecord.Col1

member.name: P:NPOI.DDF.EscherClientAnchorRecord.Dx1
member.summary: Gets or sets The x offset within the top-left cell. Range is from 0 to 1023.

member.summary: Gets or sets The row number for the top-left corner of the shape.

member.name: P:NPOI.DDF.EscherClientAnchorRecord.Dy1
member.summary: Gets or sets The y offset within the top-left corner of the current shape.

member.summary: Gets or sets The column of the bottom right corner of this shape.

member.summary: Gets or sets The y offset withing the cell for the bottom-right corner of this shape.

member.name: T:NPOI.DDF.EscherArrayProperty

members.member: The size of the header that goes at the start of the array, before the data
Normally, the size recorded in the simple data (for the complex data) includes the size of the header. There are a few cases when it doesn't though...
When Reading a property from data stream remeber if the complex part is empty and Set this flag.

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherArrayProperty.GetElement(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the element.
member.param: The index.

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherArrayProperty.SetElement(System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the element.
member.param: The index.
The element.

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherArrayProperty.ToString
member.summary: Retrieves the string representation for this property.

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherArrayProperty.SetArrayData(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: We have this method because the way in which arrays in escher works is screwed for seemly arbitary reasons. While most properties are fairly consistent and have a predictable array size, escher arrays have special cases.
member.param: The data array containing the escher array information
The offset into the array to start Reading from.
member.returns: the number of bytes used by this complex property.

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherArrayProperty.SerializeSimplePart(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Serializes the simple part of this property. ie the first 6 bytes. Needs special code to handle the case when the size doesn't include the size of the header block

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherArrayProperty.GetActualSizeOfElements(System.Int16)
member.summary: Sometimes the element size is stored as a negative number. We negate it and shift it to Get the real value.
member.param: The size of elements.

member.name: T:NPOI.DDF.EscherBoolProperty
member.summary: Represents a bool property. The actual utility of this property is in doubt because many of the properties marked as bool seem to actually contain special values. In other words they're not true bools. @author Glen Stampoultzis

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherBoolProperty.#ctor(System.Int16,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an instance of an escher bool property.
member.param: The property number (or id)
The 32 bit value of this bool property

member.name: P:NPOI.DDF.EscherBoolProperty.IsTrue
member.summary: Whether this bool property is true
member.value: true if this instance is true; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:NPOI.DDF.EscherBoolProperty.IsFalse
member.summary: Whether this bool property is false
member.value: true if this instance is false; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:NPOI.DDF.EscherContainerRecord
member.summary: Escher container records store other escher records as children. The container records themselves never store any information beyond the standard header used by all escher records. This one record is used to represent many different types of records. @author Glen Stampoultzis

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherContainerRecord.FillFields(System.Byte[],System.Int32,NPOI.DDF.EscherRecordFactory)
member.summary: The contract of this method is to deSerialize an escher record including it's children.
member.param: The byte array containing the Serialized escher records.
The offset into the byte array.
A factory for creating new escher records

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherContainerRecord.Serialize(System.Int32,System.Byte[],NPOI.DDF.EscherSerializationListener)
member.summary: Serializes to an existing byte array without serialization listener. This is done by delegating to Serialize(int, byte[], EscherSerializationListener).
member.param: the offset within the data byte array.
the data array to Serialize to.

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherContainerRecord.HasChildOfType(System.Int16)
member.summary: Do any of our (top level) children have the given recordId?
member.param: The record id.
member.returns: true if [has child of type] [the specified record id]; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:NPOI.DDF.EscherContainerRecord.Display(System.Int32)
